title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Tuesday, 19 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: military charity sees increase in veterans needing help .
norwich city complete the signing of northern ireland goalkeeper michael mcgovern .
cricket : norfolk beat buckinghamshire by 239 runs .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us today .
it 's been a bit of scorcher , with norfolk basking in temperatures reaching the 30s but these students from sheringham high school made the most of it with a surf activity day in cromer .
we 'll be back with regular updates tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
have a good ( if perhaps a bit warm and sticky ) evening .

documents.title: phew what a scorcher !
text: i could n't end my tour of norfolk without using that saying , could i ?
great yarmouth 's golden mile has been busy today - but the town 's shops were still popular with shoppers , this was the scene on regent street a short while ago .
as temperatures in the town cool down , people are heading to britannia pier for the evening 's entertainment .
and it 's time for these horses to put their feet up - i think i 'll join them .
that 's all from me and my whirlwind tour of norfolk 's hot-spots - hope you 've enjoyed it .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: weather : warm and humid overnight
text: a fine evening with some late sunshine but prepare for an uncomfortable night as it 's going to be warm and humid with temperatures only falling to 20c ( 68f ) .
another hot and humid day tomorrow , but some isolated showers could develop , with a chance of turning thundery .
maximum temperature : 30c ( 86f ) .
weather has more details of the forecast where you live .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: feed the birds tuppence a bag
text: cats and birds it 's like summerwatch .
josie tompkins , visiting from essex , with her daughter denise burkey and her son max , having been making the most of the sunshine in wroxham with some feathered friends .
denise , who lives a few miles away in buxton , said they were out to enjoy the sunshine and get ice-creams .

documents.title: feeling hot under the collar
text: `` doggy friendly cromer '' says daniel and joanne dean , from sheffield .
they 're brought five of their seven dogs out for a seaside ice-cream join-up with fellow yorkshire visitors kirsty and dave wetherall .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: it 's cool for cats
text: not everyone 's a fan of the heat !

documents.title: lorry containing dead turkeys overturns
text: a lorry carrying dead turkeys has overturned , spilling them onto the road in reepham .
it happened earlier this afternoon , but there are still delays on cawston road while police deal with the situation .
the lorry driver was n't injured and no other vehicles were involved .
lorry carrying dead turkeys overturns causing delays on reepham road , cawston .
fowl play ?
that 's literally the most norfolk reason for a blocked road
they should be just about cooked by now then
aaaaw bootiful norfolk , dont ever change @ twitterid
cluck cluck !
or not
were they dead before ?
felt sorry for the officers having to direct traffic , the smell was something else
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: ahoy there me hearties !
text: my mini-tour of norfolk 's hotspots has brought me to great yarmouth , where these visitors are looking longingly at the golden mile 's pirate ship .
it 's not quite `` pirates of the caribbean '' - but we 're not far behind in the temperature stakes , according to the bbc website `` how hot is it where you are ? ''
not everyone was feeling energetic - preferring horse power to manpower !
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: £ 400,000 raised for wymondham church building
text: hope community church in wymondham has announced that , having raised £ 400k , it will be embarking on the next step of its visionary building project to create a church and building that can accommodate 500 people .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: city boss aims to come out fighting
text: relegation pain will drive on neil and his players to greater heights - the back page of today 's norwich evening news .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: 'more awareness of ptsd ' says veteran
text: a former soldier who runs a support group for former members of the armed forces says he 's not surprised that more people are looking for help .
a report by the military charity , ssafa , has shown a 25 % rise in the number of veterans in norfolk seeking help .
former coldstream guard luke woodley , who served in bosnia , says there 's more awareness of issues like post-traumatic stress disorder .
mr woodley , who runs his own support service - .

the walnut tree project in norwich , says norfolk has a good level of support available , with ssafa , walking with the wounded , project nova and outside the wire , plus the new britannia veterans centre at hmp norwich .

the military gave me a diagnosis but no treatment life became a real struggle and everywhere i reached out to focused on physical injuries in my medical record and seemed to be blind to the fact that there was a mental health diagnosis in those notes ``
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: military charity sees increase in veterans needing help
text: an armed forces charity is warning there 's been a big increase in the number of veterans in norfolk needing help .
ssafa says it helped more than 500 people in the county in 2015 , a 25 % rise on the previous year .

the charity 's chief executive , air-vice marshall david murray , says people think of veterans as old men marching with berets and medals , but they 've found the number of younger veterans coming to them has increased .

more and more people are needing help at ssafa we 're finding that these people are falling off the cliff and our concern is what 's happening to hand the more vulnerable people over from the armed forces back into society and health provision seamlessly . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: development on scandal-hit site could get the green light
text: an extra £ 2m could be approved by norwich city councillors to develop a site that was embroiled in a scandal eight years ago .

in 2008 , elderly residents were moved out of greyhound opening , near the city 's dereham road , when the city council bought it for development.. for a time , they allowed city hall staff to live there which was against policy .

last year 105 homes were approved to be built on the goldsmith street site and tonight councilors are recommended to give their approval for development budget to increase from £ 15m to £ 17m after final costs were confirmed .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unique fighter pen opens after restoration
text: a war-time bomb proof pen at the former raf coltishall airbase has been officially opened today after restoration .
built from cement-impregnated sandbags , the open-topped construction hid two fighter planes - either spitfires or hurricanes - protecting them from possible bomb blasts .
the airbase - to the north of norwich - is now the scottow enterprise park .
david gurney , historic environment manager for norfolk county council says the pen is a `` unique survival '' .

i do n't think there 's one as a building like this left anywhere else originally there were 12 of these fighter pens and sheds at coltishall and this is the only one that 's survived , right through demolitions and cold war . ''
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: market 's roofs open for 'maintenance purpose ' only
text: a spokeswoman for norwich city council has responded to anger from the city 's market traders that the council has been refusing to open up the perspex panels which cover the walk ways between the stalls .
in a statement , the council says they understand that two or three days of hot weather this week will be causing `` very warm working conditions for some traders on the market . ''

there are gaps between each of the perspex roofs along the aisles of norwich market to allow air to circulate through , but the roofs themselves can currently only be opened for maintenance purposes . ''

documents.title: breakingcricket : norfolk beat buckinghamshire by 239 runs
text: a superb bowling performance from captain chris brown has helped norfolk to a comfortable win over buckinghamshire in the minor counties championship .
they bowled the visitors all out for 101 at manor park to wrap up victory by 239 runs .
brown took seven for 47 .
it 's norfolk 's first championship win of the season .
they take on lincolnshire in a thee-day game that starts on sunday as the manor park festival continues .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: market traders getting steaming hot
text: traders on norwich market are steaming at the city council 's refusal to open up perspex roofs which cover the aisles between the stalls .

richard lovett , who runs reggie 's tea stall , says he 's had only a few customers coming to his stall today as people have been complaining that it 's too hot to walk into the market and they feel they might pass out .
mr lovett says controls for the canvas awnings on the sides of stalls have n't worked in years , and the council has ignored the traders ' repeated requests for the roofs to be operated by remote .
we keep asking for the awnings to be replaced or repaired as a lot of them have got rips in and are no good in winter either because the rain comes through , soaking customers . ''

documents.title: i 'll have a 99 please : chilling in chapelfield
text: from west norfolk to norwich city centre and people have been making the most of norwich 's chapelfield park to enjoy an ice cream in the shade of the trees .

documents.title: the mercury is rising
text: it 's nudging 33c ( 91f ) in west norfolk - thanks to bbc weather watcher mnorgaileta for this snapshot of the thermometer at the front of her house .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: taking a splash to cool off ? take care in the water
text: advice from the rnli on the hottest day of the year :
it 's the # hottestdayoftheyear take care , # respectthewater & call 999 if you find yourself or anyone else in trouble

documents.title: heat affecting broads bridge
text: urgent boating news - reedham bridge is suffering with heat problems and is unable to swing .
once it cools down should be back in action

documents.title: breakingcricket : norfolk closing in on victory
text: norfolk are three wickets away from beating buckinghamshire in the minor counties championship .
the visitors are struggling on 54 for 7 at manor park having been set 341 to win .
norfolk captain chris brown has taken six for 28 so far .
it means he has now taken more than 500 wickets for the county in all competitions .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: bridges may be a problem for broads boaters this afternoon
text: urgent boating news - reedham and somerleyton bridges are currently operational but high temperatures are expected which may cause issues

documents.title: canaries confirm mcgovern signing
text: norwich city have completed the signing of northern ireland goalkeeper michael mcgovern .
the 32-year old played under city manager alex neil at his previous club hamilton and has signed a three-year contract at carrow road .
mcgovern starred for northern ireland at euro 2016 and will compete with john ruddy and declan rudd for the number one shirt at city next season .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: cricket : norfolk well on top against buckinghamshire
text: we 'll have more sunshine news later , but first a look at the other news and sport today .
norfolk need to take seven more wickets in the final two sessions of their minor counties championship match against buckinghamshire to wrap up their first win of the season .
bucks are 35 for three shortly after lunch .
they have been set 341 to win .
chris brown has taken two of the wickets for norfolk so far .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: in search of a breeze - it 's cooler on cromer 's cliffs
text: stephanie , harry and jason smith from chelmsford have been holidaying in cromer for the last nine days .
today , they 've been enjoying the cooling breeze on the cliff as they play pitch and putt .
they 'll be returning home to essex tonight and want to take the weather with them .
jason - an industrial worker - is heading to scotland tomorrow .
where the weather forecast is n't so good .
i 'm sorry we ca n't bottle the norfolk sunshine for you .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: costa del cromer at lunchtime
text: from the broads to the coast and if you want a bit of peace and quiet on the beach then cromer is the place to be .
this was the scene about an hour ago .
it seems people were resisting a paddle maybe they 're enjoying the helter-skelter instead
or promenading on the pier !
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

text: e anglia - popping out for lunch ?
it 's a warm one ; already 30c in many places , but a refreshing 24c in lowestoft

when your working here its not quite as refreshing as you think dan

it 's looking unlikely for vast majority of east anglia , perhaps an isolated intense storm late tomorrow afternoon/evening
@ twitterid in dereham today

documents.title: the sun 's shining in wroxham
text: we 've been catching up with people making the most of the sunshine in norfolk today .
here 's victor and margaret russell enjoying a day trip on the norfolk broads .
the couple , from liverpool , are holidaying in great yarmouth and decided to pop over to wroxham .
there , they asked christine and paul davis about boating .
mr and mrs davis , from preston , said they were enjoying their first ever broads holiday - and all four are delighted with the hot weather promised for the week ahead .
i know , i know i got my finger in the frame .
i promise not to do it again .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

text: a heatwave might have been good news for martha & the vandellas but heatstroke can be pretty horrible .
we 're all being encouraged to protect ourselves .
here 's some tips from public health england ( phe ) :

text: driver may have fallen asleep at the wheel , inquest is told - the front page of today 's norwich evening news .

documents.title: traffic : latest updates for the county
text: the a140 ipswich road in keswick is blocked , with queueing traffic northbound at the b1113 junction , because of an accident involving two vehicles .
the a47 in wisbech is partially blocked eastbound between the b198 cromwell road and the a1101 elm road junctions because of a two-vehicle accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: breakingnorfolk set buckinghamshire 341 to win at manor park
text: norfolk have declared on the final day of their minor counties championship match against buckinghamshire at manor park .
they reached 225 for 9 in their second innings with brett stolworthy 's 37 not out helping norfolk to a lead of 340 .
it means buckinghamshire have just over two sessions to reach their victory target of 341 .
norfolk need to bowl them all out to win .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'bronzed adonis ' beaton into last 16 at darts championship
text: north walsham 's steve beaton ( he 's `` in it to win it '' after pulling off a shock at the world matchplay darts .
`` the bronzed adonis '' beat 10th seed jelle klassen 10-6 at blackpool 's winter gardens .
he now faces michael smith in round 2 tonight .
bradwell 's mervyn king is also in the last 16 where he faces brendan dolan .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: neil dismisses any player power fears
text: norwich boss confident he will call the shots during contract talks - the back page of today 's eastern daily press .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: arsonists must be caught
text: appeal after latest in spate of vehicle fires - the front page on today 's eastern daily press .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: perfect weather for cricket
text: norfolk cricket fans have been blessed by the weather for this year 's manor park festival .
several hundred spectators are expected to be at the ground near horsford today for the final day of their minor counties championship match against buckinghamshire .
another beautiful morning at manor park with norfolk looking to build on their overnight lead of 262 @ twitterid
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: it 's hot in the city
text: not everyone 's heading to the coast today - the goodby family of thorpe hamlet have decided to hit the shops .
here 's lisa , clare pushing lexie-mae and granny susan with junior .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: cricket : norfolk aim for first championship win of the season
text: play is just getting under way at manor park in horsford on the final day of their minor counties championship match against buckinghamshire .
norfolk will resume on 144 for 7 in their second innings , a lead of 259 with three wickets in hand .
they 'll need to set bucks a total and then bowl them all out to clinch victory today .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: pollen levels high and uv very high
text: with temperatures set to hit the 30s with unbroken sunshine , it 's no surprise that uv levels today are very high
hayfever sufferers should also be aware that as well as being scorching hot , there 's going to be high pollen levels today too across the east of england
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: yesterday was hot will today be hotter ?
text: here 's bbc look east 's weatherman dan with the scorchio scores on the doors from yesterday it 's set to get even warmer today .
but will the mercury rise higher today ?
e anglia yesterday 's max temps 29.4c cavendish 28.9c cambridge + monks wood 28.8c writtle 28.7c s'n downham 28.6c woburn 28.2c houghton hall

documents.title: sorry the updates have n't been showing
text: we 've had technical problems on local live this morning - sorry about that .
the live updates should start appearing again now .
they 've also returned below this post .

documents.title: in summer from the city to the coast
text: it 's set to be the hottest day of the year , with temperatures in norwich already about 20c ( 68f ) .
this was the view in castle meadow a short while ago .
we 'd love to see your of norfolk at work or play in the sunshine today .
tweet us using # nfklive - and we 're just wondering , how hot is it in your vehicle ?
dashboard temperature shots please .
thanks to bbc watcher watcher tigger2 for this `` nowcast '' from gorleston-on-sea where it 's sunny and 21c ( 70f ) .

documents.title: disruption for rail passengers
text: a replacement bus service is running on abellio greater anglia between norwich and great yarmouth due to a points failure at acle .
and a points failure at reedham is causing delays for passengers on services between norwich and lowestoft .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: the hazards of open water
text: during the mini-heatwave be careful of cooling off in open water .
it can contain a number of hazards , including unseen debris , near freezing temperatures and undercurrents .
dan phillips of the east of england ambulance service warns the cold water can also numb arms and legs , leading to hypothermia .
every year we 're called out to incidents where people need help in lakes , rivers , ponds , quarries and canals and need emergency medical care .
one poor decision could lead to a serious situation . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: keeping cool in the sun
text: with temperatures set hit the 30s today , the east of england ambulance service has issued this advice on how to beat the heat and stay safe in the sun :
the service saw a surge in 999 calls at the weekend , with an average of 3,370 daily calls between 15 and 17 july , compared to 3,075 in their busiest period of easter .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fifty firefighters tackle metfield farm complex blaze
text: more than 50 firefighters have been on the scene of a fire at an agricultural business at metfield near halesworth .
crews from suffolk and norfolk were called to one building on the common just before 02.00 , but it later spread to three other buildings .
suffolk 's learned that no-one has been injured and the fire has been brought under control .
author: Kelly McCormack
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: weather : hot and sunny
text: today will be the hottest day of the year so far , with lots of sunshine and clear blue skies .
uv levels and the pollen count will be high .
temperatures reaching 31c ( 88f ) , but it will be cooler on the coast .
weather has more .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hello from norfolk live on a hot , hot , tuesday
text: good morning from the norfolk live team - we 'll be here until 18:00 , with news , sport , travel and weather updates for you .

it 's going to be another day of bright blue skies across the county and feeling hot , hot , hot so if you 're out and about , why not take a photo to share with us - or take a quick snap of the temperature on your car dashboard .
this was the view in diss this morning
it 's hot enough at 7am for a hot air balloon ride over diss # nfklive
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
